alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 07 at 11:38PM PST until December 09 at 6:23AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .The Chehalis River near Porter continues to fall but remains in flood tonight. Light rain in the area is not expected to impact flood levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River at Porter. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM PST Thursday the stage was 48.5 feet. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 PM PST Thursday was 48.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue falling to 45.5 feet late Sunday afternoon. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Friday morning at 745 AM PST.
